alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Camden; Cape May; Coastal Atlantic; Cumberland; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 2:47PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Atlantic, northeastern Cumberland, southeastern Camden, southeastern Gloucester and northeastern Cape May Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Victory Lakes, or 11 miles north of Vineland, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Vineland, Atlantic City, Ocean City, Pleasantville, Hammonton, Somers Point, Ventnor City, Brigantine, Northfield, Absecon, Margate City, Buena, Egg Harbor City, Weymouth, Estell Manor, Newfield, Port Republic, Longport, Corbin City and Elwood-Magnolia. This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 25 and 48. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 0 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If you are at the beach, allow some extra time to seek shelter.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic; Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Camden; Cape May; Coastal Atlantic; Cumberland; Gloucester
